OTR IS NOT SECURE ANYMORE, FOLKS! USE OMEMO INSTEAD!!!!! OTR was busted several years ago alongside the key-type that it requires, SHA-1, which is now also insecure. Hello dear developers. I have few questions about the size of the app. Why the previous update 2.3.3 was around 2-3 MB and this update 2.3.4 over 7 MB? There are no new featutes just a small fix. My android version is the same 8.0. I am curious to know why is that difference? Also when I compile myself the app(free compat debug) with Android Studio on Windows 8, the size of the app is almost three times bigger, about 17 MB. Thank you for the best xmpp app on the market!
replyContent: The file size increased with 2.3.0 and the introduction of TLSv1.3 support. We now bundle our own SSL library to provide that feature on all Android versions.

When I purchased Conversations, it still supported OTR. It was pretty much 
a powerhouse XMPP client compared to other offerings. Sad to say it's not 
getting much use as OMEMO adoption isn't moving very quickly and OTR 
support was dropped.

I'd really love to see a feature that allows me more control over when 
notifications show. For example tie it to a location or wifi network. That 
way I could set it to only notify for that server when I am at home.

The client itself is good, however it doesn't follow Google Material Design 
guidelines and looks like a black sheep among other apps. Still lacks some 
small features like shared media list, search filters, etc.

Privacy is not a political issue. Please return OTR capabilities till omemo 
is universally accepted.

content: After using Conversations for more than two years gladly (apart from a few minor UX mistakes and questionable decisions) it now undergoes harsh changes with version 2.0.  OMEMO is now enabled by default for _all_ new chats. This, while beeing a good way onboarding, has to be turned off inconviniently for every single chat manually if the user does not want it to be shoved down the throat for whatever reason. This may have easily been an option in "expert settings". Further, OTR support was removed without any public comment, explanation and perceptible rationale. While manual resource naming (as sensible common practice since the inception of Jabber) has _never_ been there, Conversations at least gave the user the ability to choose from a set of predefined and distinguishable resource presets. This, while not ideal, was sufficient. Now, this option has also been cut down without any rationale.  These, amongst other changes in earlier versions, e.g. the perky "conversations.im" commercial nagging when adding your Jabber account, reveals the dark path that lies ahead to the walled garden of other mobile messenger failures.  One star until sanity is restored.
replyContent: Have a look at Conversations Legacy https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=eu.siacs.conversations.legacy

replyContent:
The annual fee is for the *optional* server. You can use the app with what ever server you want. Take a look here: https://gultsch.de/compliance_ranked.html
OTR is known to be extremely unreliable in general. Not just with Conversations. You should migrate to OMEMO.

The UI is great and the developer is very responsive.

Not bad. A couple of things I wish I could changes, like remove or reduce avatar to increase room for messages. Also, remove the "Message from Stranger...Block" bar at bottom. It is extremely annoying.
replyContent: Add the contact to your contact list to make the "Message received from stranger" message go away. (Or respond with a message of your own.)

content: This is hands down the best xmpp app for android.  But note: most of the features depend on the servers, and because it does not require google cloud messaging, it uses quite a bit more battery than the usual messenger app.
Hoping for the ability to have gifs animate while in the message field of view instead of opening it in a separate window.  Also, a short video plug in soon would be useful too.  Great app so far!
replyContent: You haven't responded to my last email in responds to your support inquiry. However this problem might be fixed in 1.14.4

content: Good messenger overall. Unfortunately do not support text formatting. Will be nice to have this future.
Doesn't sync messages properly across devices.
replyContent:
Please make sure the XMPP Server you are using is implementing the 2016 Compliance Suite. For public servers you can check this here: https://gultsch.de/compliance_ranked.html
Please contact support inputmice@siacs.eu if you need more assistance.

content: I had problems in the setup, but I got it working. This is nice.
replyContent: Please send us an email to daniel@siacs.eu and specify your XMPP server/domain and if you are trying to send encrypted messages.

content: Only mobile xmpp client i found with working file transfer. I use it with my Prosody server and it works great.
My favorite XMPP client in general. Very useful and well-implemented. Thank you developers!
Never worked properly ... always missed messages or crashed ... really want a refund.
replyContent: If you send us an email to inputmice@siacs.eu and specify the server you are using we might be able to help you. Did you send in the automated crash reports?

content: Would love to see a video snippet plug-in too!
Blooming great!
Featureful, good UI, good end-to-end crypto. Good replacement of the much hyped Signal.

Please add option for status indicators. I can't tell if online contacts are away.. Also PLEASE fix the constant jabber reconnects. My connection is perfectly stable and no other apps have this issue.. Also would love an option for persistent notification to indicate I'm online in the background, similar to how IM+ does it.
How to find my OTR fingerprint? How to import my own OTR key? How to exit from app completely with background services too?

Well-functioning client with XEP-280 support and that allows me sending and receiving photos with the people I chat with. Very stable - has so far never crashed on my devices. Good verbosity on showing which xep features that the connected server supports. Nice dark theme.
Also available on F-Droid
No recent problems
replyContent: Please contact me on daniel@siacs.eu and describe your problem in more detail.

content: Great app with great support.
It cannot connect to my xmpp server, only prompts unauthorized even I have had all right account input. The same account info may work well with other appz.
replyContent: Please contact support (inputmice@siacs.eu) with more information (what server, what other clients this is working with etc). Otherwise we can't help you.

content: Can someone please fix the failure of Open Keychain to do its job? Please?
Greater great greatest ha...

I had to buy the app to realise it is not what I needed. but in under 10 minutes I couldnt get a refund. That's very unsatisfactory in my books. If there is no free or trial version there should at least be a refund ability.

With ejabberd in a raspberry pi, omemo encryption, no server to server, message archive management, it is great to exchange photos and videos with peace of spirit.. and server backup! Waiting with baited breath for video/audio implementation (there is a bounty for that).
Best jabber/xmpp app to exist!
My contacts are not receiving images I send. They all say waiting. It is through Google talk.
replyContent: Please use a more modern server that is compliant with the official 2016 compliance suite. Google has dropped their XMPP support years ago. Find compliant servers here https://gultsch.de/compliance_ranked.html

content: The best Android jabber client so far!
I'm unable to look at contact status and last online time. I think that's a necessary thing for XMPP client especially paid one when you have free alternatives with richer functionality
Top flight secure messaging app
Simple, effective, intuitive.
This is hands-down the best XMPP client, not just on Android, but anywhere. We need more feature-rich and usable apps like this in the world.

All the features required to enjoy rich content chatting plus the automation of end to end (e2e) encryption. Even though. I have F-Droid, I purchased it here to support the developers =). This app is capable of all the features provided by google hangouts with the added bonus of e2e encryption and far more efficient battery consumption. It is just a matter of configuring your server appropriately to enable the XEPs required to support the features. I'm using eJabberd 16.08 so I can guarantee you that at least the 16.08+ versions support all the features.

I wanted to use this with Oracle Beehive XMPP, but the reliance on a specific SRV record instead of allowing custom server name and port is, frankly, counterproductive. If this is the best XMPP app for Android, it should not close off avenues like basic custom settings. This is unfortunate, and so I got a refund. I guess the next stop is Xabber.
replyContent: Contact us to get a free promo code if you want to try again. It will work if you go to the settings / expert settings and check the box 'Show extended connection options' and return to the account setup. Custom port and hostname are possible it's just hidden away to not confuse regular users. For beehive you also need to set the port to 5223.

content: Like it
Fine.

Works great against a prosody XMPP server.  Carbon Copy: works (meesages go to Psi+ and Conversations) Mentions: work (notifications when my nick is mentioned in a conference, quiet otherwise) Notifications on keywords in a conference: not implemented (oh well).  Overall it's not as feature-rich as Xabber, but so far it's less buggy and the UI is much better.

UPDATED RATE: Original scored 1 star because it didn't function with work IM. Daniel bent over backward to provide a timely solution that was customized to my company.  Great product,  INCREDIBLE customer support!  Thanks, Daniel.
replyContent: This is due to a non-standard compliant and improperly configured server. However today's update (1.13.8) includes a workaround for that server.

content: Conversations is the best XMPP client, even better than desktop XMPP clients. With a XMPP server which supports the needed xep's its a powerfull modern communication tool!
Thanks for the OTR, OpenPGP, OMEMO  (Axolotl) support!
The best XMPP application I found in the store.
Great app
It has some UI flaws and limited functionality. But it supports OMEMO and other nice features.
Awesome jabber client
now I can run my own xmpp server and replace whatsapp. best xmpp app I've found. I wish I could find a desktop equivalent (mam and http_publish support)
Good App for Skywarn net controllers

No presence priorities, no ad-hoc commands, no service discovery, no per-jid resource lists ‚Äì but also no problems. Beautiful and functional UI. Message carbons and MAM ensure continuous experience between devices as well as desktops. Better than anything else.
Best XMPP client on Android
Exactly as advertised
It's usable but I dont like it. You can't change the colors of anything and the picture sending feature just doesn't work.
Disgusting to see last seen function is removed after update.
replyContent: The Last Seen / Last Activity feature is back in 1.13.0. Properly implemented and actually working. It is opt-in for obvious privacy reasons.

content: This is my go-to replacement for the slack app. Notifications always appear the second messages arrive, any conversation I read is marked as read, and of course all the basics are there too. Plus it's open source!
Keeps delivering konstant improvements, just a great xmpp-app
This is the best XMPP client I've ever used on a phone!  It's well worth a couple dollars.
The best app out there, on any platform, for reliable, easy and transparent XMPP chats.
This client is consistent, offers three types of encryption, and is reliable. I have NEVER experienced a crash! I'm happy with the performance and use it regularly.

Modern feature wise, modern ui, actively developed, almost feature complete. Looks much like hangouts, I just wish there were a similar desktop application. The new share feature (HttpUpload) is great and makes Conversations on pair with hangouts chat etc.

This app is written very well but lacks the ability to set xmpp client priorities which is hugely important for my use.  From what I did see this client worked beautifully with my openfire server and pulled logged conversations from the server seamlessly. It's a lot more polished and usable than Xabber and probably better for most people but Xabber has more of the good ol' jabber in it where this one does not.

Switched to this from Xabber on advice from a co worker.  Love the interface but the battery drain is much higher than Xabber.  Xabber on a typical day uses about 10-14% battery.  So far conversations has ranged from 12%to 24% usage.

I have an XMPP server that I can successfully connect to with ADIUM on the Mac It requires an explicit server and the options - Force old-style SSL - Require SSL-TLS Conversations does not allow for me to use these options, and hence, I cannot use it. Any suggestions?  Since I bought Conversations for this, this is an essential...
replyContent: This is not a standard compliant XMPP server. However today's Conversations update (1.13.8) includes a work around for this if you manually set the port to 5223 after enabling the Extended Connection Options.

content: Good XMPP client with lots of features. However such basic thing as going offline is somewhat complicated in here. Apart from that, app is nice and easy to use.
Does not have advanced settings. It will just say incompatible server when I connect to our xmmp server
replyContent: Incompatible server happens if your server doesn't support STARTTLS. Please enable encryption on your Server. Conversations won't connect over a plain text connection. (In very old ejabberds you have to enable that explicitly. Also think about updating your ejabberd to something more recent when you have the time.)

content: works great. Love the pgp encryption and the integration with openkeycain app. Keeps up the good work
replyContent: Please contact me (inputmice@siacs.eu) and describe what you are trying to do exactly and what error you are getting.

content: Not respecting doze mode is obe of those.
replyContent: If your server supports push you can keep doze disabled

content: Works as expected.  Very pleased.
Does not work with employer xmpp server. No option to request refund.
replyContent: Please send us an email to inputmice@siacs.eu and describe your problem

content: Thanks to the developer for taking XMPP on Android into the modern era with TOR support, OMEMO support and a beautiful app. Very happy with conversations and happy to support the development. Keep up the great work!
Great App!  I haven't experienced any connectivity issues with Conversations like I have with other apps of this type.  It also has a very minimal battery drain.
Nice software!

This App is very close to others like WhatsApp and Hangouts. It connects beautifully to your own XMPP server too. It fails to connect to conferences which is a major let down and you have to enable FOREGROUND service to receive push, bit annoying. Otherwise this is an absolutely superb App!!!
Der beste xmpp Client am Markt.
–ù–æ—Ä–º

Having trouble with my Openfire server - unable to publish avatars, but no problem with other clients. Also file transfers aren't working - works with other clients too. 5 stars if these two issues can be resolved.
Superior privacy and security over Xabber and Chat Secure
Modern, neat, contemporary XMPP client, for the win!
Wow! Very impressive client! Only thing left for me to wish for is a dark theme actually! I'd love to see this app dressed in black! ^^ great work!
but please, don't show otr messages with wrong key!

Everything works great. Only section  where contact list in ui is not resized well on Android nexus 6. I see part of the previous conversation window on the right. I think it should be hidden with ability to slide right.
Unusual approach to build xmpp client but it's worth it on a modern server! Default settings could be more revealing the nice features.
Way better than facebooks messenger app.
Can we customize sidebar width in future versions? Or maybe better hide/show it on demand? Or both ) thanks
Stable with regular updates and new features. Keep them coming. UPDATE: Still hands down the best XMPP client on android. However, would like to request a reminder feature to developer.
Pebble API quick reply support would make it even better!
Works perfect!

I really like business model of this application, It's free software but to download it from google play you have to pay. There are lot of implication in favour of user.   Problem with IM+ or other xmpp + OTR app was that I never wasn't sure if OTR is done on my cellphone or on their servers. I didn't know if keys are stored also in their servers or only in my device. But with this application because of free software nature you have source codes so you are able to audit code if you want.   Also in previous I had problem with IM+ Pro and their support doesn't act at all. But with free software app I don't need to relay on official support and I can just support it by myself or buy support from third party. There is no proprietary lock up.   I'm also supprised how well this app does work. I tried to turn off app and then ping my xmpp client, and I get that message immediatelly. I'm not sure how this is possible, I'll look at the source code, but it's possible that you guys are using push notification or something? if so how? I know you didn't use server thin client.)
Looking for alternatives, I see an empty room.
Great design and use of the XMPP protocol. I wish there were more clients like this.
Best Client Ever
replyContent:
File sharing in non-anonymous groups is possible as of version 1.5.0
This requires a server side extension you can find here: https://github.com/siacs/HttpUploadComponent

content: Ever since the 1.6.0 update, this has been absolutely killing my battery. Constantly the top drain and has taken hours off my standby time.  Uninstalled this app, suddenly my battery drain is back to normal. Pity, it is a well designed XMPP client but when it single handedly causes my standby time to be only around 12 hours, that's a deal-breaker. Update: the new version also used over 200 megs of data idling in two days, which is another deal breaker since I pay for data.
replyContent:
Please contact support on inputmice@siacs.eu and tell us what server you are using.
If you are using ejabberd 2.10 on your server please update your server or disable PEP. If this is not your server try to pick a different one. I'm sorry. If this doesn't work for you i'm happy to do a refund. See https://github.com/siacs/Conversations/issues/1359

content: OpenPGP support, great
Quite pleased with this. The only capable XMPP client remaining for Android with support for modern XMPP extensions. Keep up the excellent work.

Thanks for the reply  1. Image share in group (which will work on HTTPS) 2. Voice share in group (HTTPS) 3. Emoticons. 4. Internal audio player so that we can play the received audio without using another audio player.
replyContent: The HttpUploadComponent already works with HTTPS. You just have to set it up properly. Read the README again

content: Bought this intending to use it with OpenKeychain (like I do for Password Store and K-9 Mail). It fails when I try to publish my key to RiseUp's server. Given that my other apps work fine with YubiKey and OpenKeychain, I think it's an issue with this app.
replyContent: There have been several bugfixes regarding the OpenPGP support. I don't have a yubikey myself. But it should work now.

content: The best XMPP app around. Puts the others to shame.
Would love it if you could add an emoticons feature :)

The account setup screen assumes that you are trying to connect to a Jabber service, but I was looking for a way to consolidate all of my XMPP based communications. This is not designed for that, apparently.
replyContent:
Hi, can you send an email to inputmice@siacs.eu quickly explaining what you mean by 'XMPP based communications'? Usually Jabber and XMPP are considered synonyms. Jabber technically being a brand name though.
Conversations should be able to connect to all XMPP based IM services.

content: Full features that really works.  Nothing in IOS that works properly in group chat,  so please please have it available in IOS too.
Between all the crappy or battery-eating Jabber apps, this one definitely stands out. This app brings Jabber's user experience back in par with Hangouts!
Nice UI update :D
This is exactly what I'd expect from any messaging client designed for Android Lollipop.
Would have given 5 if it supported (somehow) sharing of pictures to group.

Would be nice to get some more basic functions built in, current status of your contact in the icon rather than having to check the send button within a conversation.  Also, an option to see all contacts by default, rather than having to add a new conversation to see who is online.
replyContent: If you would like to see your contacts presence in the contact list try enabling 'Dynamic Tags'

content: Support very quickly fixed an initial problem that prevented the client working for me.  Some nice features, although not perfect.   Some comments sent privately
replyContent: This problem has been fixed in 1.3.0

content: I really like the looks of the app. But very disappointing with the lack of settings. All I get is username and password? What about the setup of my specific xmpp server details?  Have asked for a refund.
replyContent: Starting with version 1.9.3 you can enable custom host/port configuration in the expert settings.

content: Nice interface, but other side doesn't get media
replyContent: Please contact our support at inputmice@siacs.eu and describe your problem in more detail

content: I have my own xmpp server and when I use another android app it works perfect but when I use this one messages have to be sent multiple multiple times for them to go through.
replyContent: Please contact our support at inputmice@siacs.eu and describe your problem in more detail

content: Couldn't edit handle for group chats, and thus couldn't get into them. Otherwise, app did what it claimed.  EDIT: Author clarified how to add handle for group chat. Will be pulling this into my daily driver and use it.
replyContent: You can enter the full jid in the join conference dialog. eg room@server.tld/yournick but thats only necessary for IRC transports and the like. In normal group chats you should just see a warning nick already in use with an option to edit your nick.

content: ...look and feel. Only thing missing for me is control over resource priorities. Thanks for the great work.
Conversations is the best XMPP client for Android by leaps and bounds. Well done!
Is it possible to add possibility to read message history for gtalk account?

Apparently all kinds of other clients use HTML-like tags in messages for fonts, line breaks and so on. Those tags are displayed in this app as they are, so some messages are barely readable. If this gets fixed, five stars.

Just all-around fantastic, everything is great. It would be perfect if we could get:  * More XMPP settings (e.g. set domain and chat server separately). * A menu item to completely log off and close the app (for when I don't want to be online).
after running with jabber clients that looked like they came out of android 2, it was nice to come across an app that is modern and functional. worth every cent.
An incredible XMPP client. All it needs is a dark theme option to save my feeble eyes.
Pl help me how to create an account. It says unauthorized whenever I try to create one
replyContent: Please contact our support at daniel@siacs.eu and describe your problem in more detail. Are you using a OpenFire server?

content: We using as Olark chat support and its works fine. I like modern UI. Please make desktop version too :) Great and fast app without big bugs. Recommended.

I like the Google Hangouts look, as I was looking for a new client to use now that Google has killed its XMPP servers. This look is familiar.  It performs adequately to my needs: easy configuration, quiet hours setting, sending and receiving pictures. However, I can't find the "Desktop Client" mentioned in the decription above. It's not on your website. For a desktop client I use Pidgin at the moment, and unfortately pictures sent with this app don't show in pidgin.  This is the only downside of the app (and I don't know if the problem is with this app or with Pidgin). Please direct me to your aforementioned desktop app and I will add a star to my rating :-)
This feels like a real client for modern devices!  I really like this!  Keep up the great work!

Not only does this look like a 2015 messaging app, it also has the features one expects of modern IM software (if your server supports it). Running this with a self-hosted Prosody makes for a killer WhatsApp alternative!

Great , lightweight and simple client with enough features build in! But I personally have been having issues with the client randomly disconnecting from 1 account , sometimes both... Rather annoying , but still a nice client :)

Conversations is a very lightweight and simple XMPP client, but with a lot of advanced features implemented. Not only you can send messages, photos, audio records and files, you can encrypt your conversation using OTR or a OpenPGP bridge.  The UI is simple, modern and fast, and the code is Open Source for you to learn or improve whatever you need.  Is by far the best Android client I've found.
Excellent and thanks for making it opensource, that sold it for me!
Best XMPP Client for Android
Easily the best Android XMPP client around! You only need a server that supports the extensions and you'll have a nice WhatsApp  replacement.
One request though would be to use the last received message in the body of notifications for group chats. Otherwise it's pretty much perfect.

Glad, I waited with my review since this app gets better and better with every update and a lot of the small and annoying stuff is fixed now. A lot of good features have been added as well. And it's stable now, haven't experienced a crash with the two latest versions. One of the purchases I really enjoy!
What I want to see before I can give a higher review is the ability to display all online contacts and sort contacts by status. Im using jabber as instant messaging. Not as an SMS replacement

Best design of any XMPP client I tried.  Support for server autodiscovery great support for conferences/groups.  At work I have 1000+ contacts, handled them fine.  Missing: - Icon sync - Contact groups
love it more and more and more... can't wait to see a material design version ;)
replyContent: To see who's online have a look at the options 'use send button to indicate status' and 'show dynamic tags'

content: Works as advertised. I was a long time user of IM Pro but lateley they have issues with notifications and battery drain.
replyContent: Have a look at the preferences 'Use send button to indicate status' and 'show dynamic tags'

content: Very decent XMPP client

Far superior to other Android XMPP clients I've tried (and I've tried quite a few). Beautiful UI, very fast, and most importantly for me, has both simple OTR integration that actually plays nice with other XMPP clients like Pidgin, and group conversations. Worth every penny.

Unlike other clients, the roster is not front and center. That makes contact management annoying. Also, there is no sort by status and the indicators are not visible by default. Definitely the most beautiful Android XMPP client though.
Great app. Fast, simple and smooth. Works well with Facebook chat and Google talk

Great, clean interface. It sadly doesn't show anything anywhere indicating online/offline status of contacts. I'd like to be able to quickly tell if my coworkers are available for chat or not rather than sending and praying.
replyContent: To see who's online have a look at the options 'use send button to indicate status' and 'show dynamic tags'

content: √âs de llarg el millor client per xmpp/jabber i l'√∫nic amb transfer√®ncia de fitxers a Android!
hands down. worth the money!

Terrible application,  I can't configure my account due this doesn't provide extending settings, yes custom ports and url, is any way to by pass this ? I think setting SRV on server will be extremely hard
replyContent: Starting with version 1.9.3 you can enable custom host/port configuration in the expert settings

content: The best XMPP client for android
Nice app, and great support!
replyContent: An update has been pushed to the Play Store. I hope this will resolve your problems. I'm sorry for any inconvenience

content: really nice app - however the option to keep it active by placing it in notification area is missing - hence "closing" the app causes some problems... (connection interruption)
Nice UI, good performance. Lots of features.
BTW, thank you for the open sources.
Whilst the apps UI make it a pleasure to use, it still needs some improvement in the core. Simple thinks like sending files is limited to images only etc.
replyContent: Conversations can send any kind of files since version 0.9

content: Tried about 15 xmpp Android apps... Literally... This was by far the best.  Took me awhile to figure out how to PM (hold down on avatar), but otherwise great!  Improvement to make is to use xmpp server avatars.  Another program did this, so I know it is possible.  I'd also like to be able to start a private conversation with someone from within a conversation (instead of whispering)
Great App
Finally a great and usable XMPP-Client. And its even OpenSource! Thank you so mich for making Thei√ü!

Joining conferences works better in this app than any other android XMPP client I've tried, but I'm missing the ability to sign out, manually set my own presence, and use my server-side contact groups. I'd also like the option to NOT have the app start on boot. I use this to connect to my work IM on my personal phone and I don't want to appear online outside my work hours.
replyContent:
Hi,
you can disable (log out) an account by long pressing on the account in 'manage account' and selecting 'temporarily disable'

content: I give 5 starts because it is the best, but please, add option to hide offline contacts also, implement a way to see who is online and who is not just by lookin at contact list. Thanks!!!!

This app represents a great deal of work and an unusual amount of attention to UI aesthetics, which on Android is definitely refreshing for a messaging app of any kind. Unfortunately I have a good deal of trouble connecting to my own XMPP servers through this app, and I don't really have a lot of options at my disposal to try and fix that in this app. I would love to eventually see something like Xabber's "Custom Host" menu (which allows one to specify the server IP/FQDN and port without a SRV record or if/when it needs to be overridden, e.g. when you're behind the server's own router), though admittedly my own situation might be a bit niche. Other than this and the issue with GTalk messages constantly failing, this app is off to a fantastic start, and I look forwarding to playing with it more as it progresses.

Not a bad client, but the UI (in my opinion) is ugly and unintuitive. I would like the option to show online friends only and how does one close an existing chat? I love that you can send files and the encryption support is nice. But the UI, guys....
Looks really nice, is fast and allows encryption. And it's even OpenSource ‚Äì best client out there.

This lets me keep up with my friends on Facebook and Google Talk without having to run either of their bloated, invasive clients, while also connecting to more modern xmpp servers and supporting encrypted chats. It does this with 20% of the code size of ChatSecure, and so feels snappy and reliable. On top of that, the devs are responsive to issues and pull requests.
If there's a way to join existing conferences, I can't find it. Most of the app, A+ but that's a total deal breaker, and so frustrating that it's not there!
replyContent: In more recent versions there is a dedicated Tab for joining conferences. If you like you can have another look - and maybe update your review. Thanks

content: App was really easy to setup to use work's Jabber server although there was a untrusted certificate issue on first connecting (a notification to say this would be nice).  Using the app is easy and I prefer it over the old app I used Xabber. One thing I found lacking was the search functionality. While it shows the list of people on the server it didn't look for rooms on the conference subdomain on the server which meant I was unable to connect to the group chats there.

Looks and works great!  It would be nice to have the ability to strip html formatting from incoming messages.  Some other clients send it by default and it's a horrible mess of raw html in Conversations.  I'd also like to be able to send pictures, preferably with the image being encrypted as well (not sure how that works with OTR, though)
replyContent: Concerning the HTML I created an issue on github for you https://github.com/siacs/Conversations/issues/23 and file transfer (possible encrypted) is the main feature of the upcoming 0.2 release.

content: The support for message carbons is huge! The UI is great (though can we request a dark theme?). Also, is there a way to group the contact list by status and/or roster group?
replyContent: Thank you for feedback. Conversations was designed with the idea that you would very rarely open the contact list and just keep conversations open instead of archiving them. I will however take your feedback into account for version 0.2 and see if I can improve the filtering within the contact list.

content: Full Disclosure: The developer of this app is a friend of mine.  I've been beta-testing this app for a while, and it is the first XMPP client that I've actually found myself using quite a bit. It's built with a clean design and is packed with obscure-but-useful features.  I especially appreciate the nice balance of customizability and simplicity, where other clients tend to err on the side of too many options. This results in a really streamlined, well thought-out user experience. One can tell that a great deal of attention is payed to UX design. Another thing that makes this client really stick out is the support for various XEPs, which really, noticably improve mobility performance.   Keep in mind that this is a somewhat early version of the app, so occasionally, I still run into bugs, but these are usually fixed very quickly by the developer.
